page.title: 03COTTINGHAM. 1985.
page.content: Many of Cottingham's employed residents work in British Steel's Corby tubeworks. The second largest group is of retired people, the third group work in the shoe industry. The biggest farm, other than Rockingham Estates, is owned by Mr Reynolds and is 300 acres. 2 men do the work done by 20 in earlier days when 10 smallholders held 30 acres. The older dwellings are thought to have been built from local stone quarried from the Dale. The newer housing estates (Ripley Rd., Bancroft Rd., Bury Field Rd., Welland View, School Lane and Millfields) consist mainly of detached, 2-storey brick houses with small gardens front and rear. Most common surnames now are Claypole, Bradshaw, Harrison and Perkins. Cottingham is a desirable residential area ideal for home owners, but house prices are high compared with Corby's.
